results.title: Shop safety
results.brief_description: Discusses the causes and prevention of accidents and safety rules to be observed when welding, working on machinery, using hoists, using tools, lifting and pushing heavy objects and the handling of gasoline.

results.title: Shooting: Norm Stewart
results.brief_description: Coach Norm Stewart analyses the jump-shot and one-hand free throw. The jump-shot is viewed through its various phases while the one-hand free throw is broken into four main areas: body position, ball position, aiming, and the motion.

results.title: Shooting the past
results.creator_credit: BBC, John Chapman and Stephen Poliakoff
results.brief_description: An Award winning 3 part BBC television program set in a country house on the outskirts of London which is home to a unique photographic collection which spans the 20th century. The collection is cared for by a small team of dedicated but eccentric staff whose world is shaken when an American property developer purchases the mansion and its contents. His intention is to refurbish the house, with most of the collection, and establish a modern business school on the property. The library staff entrench themselves, determined to use any creative means to stop the break up of the photographic collection. The clash of economic rationalism and heritage values is brilliantly shown, as well as the power of photographs to chronicle and shape events and decisions. Adapted by Stephen Poliakoff from his own play. Special credit to the Hulton-Getty Picture Collection for still used throughout the drama.

results.title: Shooting scene 341 [from 'the spy who loved me']
results.brief_description: Filmed on location during the shooting of scene 341 from “The Spy who loved me”. An action scene necessitating the construction of a huge and expensive set. Includes fly-on-the-wall footage of direction, rehearsal and shooting of the scene plus commentary from the director (Lewis Gilbert), the director of photography, stunt co-ordinator, and Roger Moore. Produced for Open University.

results.title: Shooting in basketball
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Wilbur Johns
results.brief_description: Concerntrating on the set-shot, this film uses professional male basketball players to demonstrate stance, aim, trajectory, and the action of the throw, with detailed attention to fingertip control, the inward rotating movement of the hand and arm, and the co-ordination of all pars of the body required for accurates shots.

results.title: Shooting Better Home Videos
results.brief_description: Australian film director, Maurice Murphy takes you through a sixty minute demonstration of how best to use your video camera. Basic techniques are explained as well as ways to experiment and produce more interesting effects. The video is divided into eight sections:- Basic shots; Experiment; Birthday party; A day in the country; City scenes and light; Sports action; The wedding; Improving your techniques.

results.title: Shoot the nets
results.creator_credit: Cinetone Studios and Herman Van Der Horst
results.brief_description: Herring fishing in the North Sea, following a group of Dutch boats on a typical cruise. A documentary record of a Dutch trawler on its annual voyage to the Dogger Bank, fishing ground for herring. Shows the ceremonies and celebrations that usher in the herring fishing season, decking of boats with flags and departure of the fleet to the international fishing grounds. The nets are put out, the crew wake in the middle of the night for the laborious business of hauling in the catch, a storm comes up and the fleet turns home. The film stresses the cooperation at sea among fishermen of different nations who rely on the Dogger Bank for their livelihood.

results.title: Shonky golf with Mick Molloy
results.creator_credit: Radiant Industries, Stephen Luby, Emma Moss, Penelope Everett and Mick Molloy
results.brief_description: Mick Molloy, together with his coach and caddy, Alan Length, have compiled this instructional video about how to improve oneself at shonky golf. Together they cover areas such as the fundamentals (not just grip, but how to find a good parking spot in the carpark); getting the most out of the pro shop; navigating trouble spots; the mechanics of the golf cart; your relationship with the caddy, future directions in golfing attire, and most importantly, etiquette on the golf course. Put their advice into practice and you too can dubiously navigate your way around the green.

results.title: Shoeshine girl
results.creator_credit: MacDonald Productions, Jane Startz and Peter Barton
results.brief_description: Story of a problem girl who goes to stay with her aunt during the summer vacation and the relationship she forms with the shoeshine man who hires her as his assistant. Raises issues concerning cooperation with others, and respect for the individual differences and beliefs of others.
